intro: Hookera hyacinthina, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Hookera hyacinthina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
